newsitem.title: JAPAN: NEC, U.S. firm to develop next-generation LSI chip.
newsitem.headline: NEC, U.S. firm to develop next-generation LSI chip.

text.p: NEC Corp said on Monday it had expanded its joint R&D agreement with Lucent Technologies Inc of the United States for the development of next-generation system LSI (large scale integration) chips.
NEC and Lucent will jointly develop 0.18 micron CMOS device process technology for use in multimedia personal computers and other information equipment by 1999, NEC said.
The new "system on a chip" will be brought to the market in the early 21st century, NEC said.
The two firms have previously jointly developed 0.25 and 0.35 micron CMOS process technologies under the R&D agreement.
Lucent Technologies was formed as a result of A T & T's split into three separate publicly held companies.
